Precompute Correlation Matrices for Spatial Regions

Source: R/dm_functions.R
precomputeCorrMatrix.Rd

Computes correlation matrices between spatial regions using an exponential covariance function. This function supports both unweighted and population-weighted formulations.

Usage

precomputeCorrMatrix(S.coord, phi)

Arguments

S.coord

A list of lists, each containing at least a matrix named xy with point coordinates. If attr(S.coord, "weighted") is TRUE, each element must also include a vector named weight.

phi

A numeric vector of spatial scale (decay) parameters.

Value

A list containing:

R

An array of dimension [n_regions, n_regions, length(phi)] containing the correlation matrices.

phi

The input vector of spatial scale parameters.

Details

The function uses the exponential correlation function: $$\mathrm{Corr}(d) = \exp(-d / \phi)$$ where \(d\) is the Euclidean distance between points and \(\phi\) is a spatial scale parameter.

If weighted = TRUE, the function computes correlations as weighted sums using the product of weights and the exponential kernel values. Otherwise, it uses unweighted averages.

On this page
